description:
An open-source alternative to Claude Cowork, powered by OpenCode

OpenWork is an extensible, open-source “Claude Work” style system for knowledge workers.
It’s a native desktop app that runs OpenCode under the hood, but presents it as a clean, guided workflow:
- pick a workspace
- start a run
- watch progress + plan updates
- approve permissions when needed
- reuse what works (templates + skills)
The goal: make “agentic work” feel like a product, not a terminal.
Highlights
- Streamlined cloud-worker onboarding in web, including Open in App handoff, GitHub sign-in, and download page improvements.
- Improved desktop session usability with grouped exploration steps, faster markdown rendering, and clearer workspace/share flows.
Fixes & polish
- Hardened Den auth/callback/trusted-origin handling and added retries for transient signup DB reads.
- Improved workspace action/menu stability, share modal mobile readability, skill trigger truncation, and URL wrapping in settings/identities.
- Updated docs and evidence assets for the latest cloud/setup/share experience.
Packaging / ops
- Bumped all OpenWork packages to 0.11.122 and refreshed lockfiles/Cargo metadata.
- Updated AUR packaging metadata for 0.11.121 and 0.11.120.
